public class Node<SUBJECT>
extends java.lang.Object
implements java.lang.Comparable

A node in a tree. Nodes have both display names and underlying objects.

Author:
bbeaumont

isLastChild

public boolean isLastChild()
Check if this is the last child of it's parent. This is not too useful for business purposes but is important for display.

Returns:
true if this is the last child in the parents set of children.

getLevel

public int getLevel()
Get the level in hierarchy at which this node sits. Root nodes are at level = 0.

Returns:
The level in the hierarchy at which this node sites.

getAncestor

public Node getAncestor(int level)
Get the ancestor node of this node that is sitting at a particular level. This method is necessary for display purposes.

Parameters:
level - The level of the ancestor to find (0 = root level)
Returns:
The ancestor node.

setOpen

Changes whether the node is open (expanded) or closed (collapsed).

Parameters:
open - true to open the node; false to close it.
